title: bOING bOING Issue 12 - A Blueprint for the Flipside of Serious Culture
creator: Happy Mutants
description: bOING bOING started as a zine in 1988 by Mark Frauenfelder and Carla Sinclair, his wife. Issues were subtitled "The World's Greatest Neurozine". Associate editors included Gareth Branwyn, Jon Lebkowsky, and Paco Nathan. Along with Mondo 2000 , bOING bOING was an influence in the development of the cyberpunk subculture. It reached a maximum circulation of 17,500 copies. Common themes include technology, futurism, science fiction, gadgets, intellectual property, Disney and left-wing politics. The last issue of the zine was #15. Contents ode to dumbshit: the roommate from hell - patti parisi "now" with the volume cranked up: william gibson interview - marisa golini emigre: purveyors of typographic garbage - dave mandl that night in bedrock - wayne alan brenner pocket full of horses - paul di filippo the virgin couch - patti parisi punching holes in the virtual sky - jonathan stego & cypherella - sandy sandfort r.u. sirius' guide to the alternative seventies slacking in the seventies: richard linklater interview - jon lebkowsky & carla sinclair worthless commentary on my profoundly weird dazed experience - wiley wiggens the ignorant human's guide to the internet - sean carton keane vs. keane - roberts & siergey emergency personal life tv - bill barker farmer bob's good life - ward parkway front 242 interview - gareth branwyn comix zines books music welcome bouncing back neurotica online tripping - carla sinclair brain candy - mark frauenfelder zip.4 - rudy rucker ask dr. sergic - paco xander nathan fiction that bleeds truth - jon lebkowsky pranktime - carla sinclair
